sentences.sContent: You will then have only a pair of trousers, a waistcoat, a hat and a coat.
sentences.sContent_eng: You will then have only a pair of trousers, a waistcoat, a hat and a coat.
sentences.sCn: 您只剩下一条长裤，一件背心，一顶帽子和一件短上衣了。

sentences.sContent: In the cartoon, John Bull appears as a short, stocky figure wearing a waistcoat with the British flag on.
sentences.sContent_eng: In the cartoon, John Bull appears as a short, stocky figure wearing a waistcoat with the British flag on.
sentences.sCn: 在漫画中，“约翰牛”常以矮小健壮的形象出现，身穿印有英国国旗的背心。

sentences.sContent: After sleeping in the sledge and dining in the kitchen, to sit in an arm-chair in clean linen, in thin boots, with a chain on one’s waistcoat, is such luxury!
sentences.sContent_eng: After sleeping in the sledge and dining in the kitchen, to sit in an arm-chair in clean linen, in thin boots, with a chain on one’s waistcoat, is such luxury!
sentences.sCn: 经过在雪撬上睡觉和在厨房吃饭后，穿着干净的亚麻布衣服，细薄的靴子坐在靠背椅里，某人的马甲上还挂着表链，这一切是多么的奢侈了啊！

trans.tranOther: a piece of clothing without sleeves that has buttons down the front and is worn over a shirt, often under a jacket as part of a man’s suit
